commit_message:
bagpipe-bgp: move API parameters checks and conversions

move API parameters checks/conversions in a place that will
allow subcasing (eg. specific check for a type of VPN)
in a cleaner way

also adds unit tests

this change will be followed by changes to use
kwargs in more places

Change-Id: I25cad14af6da145dd56ca88115e1b7b37870002f

[{'number': 6, 'created': '2017-05-27 10:14:53.000000000', 'files': ['nova/api/openstack/compute/security_groups.py'], 'message': "Optimize creating security_group

When passing a source group_id for creating a new security group rule,
the code is looking up that group twice. We should just look that up
once at the beginning and reuse it so we don't have to hit the nova db
or neutron twice for the same thing.

Change-Id: I3ea4586d11b14da5f6d93e8d20f05171e7e6f0e8
Closes-bug: #1580621
"}]
commit_message:
Optimize creating security_group

When passing a source group_id for creating a new security group rule,
the code is looking up that group twice. We should just look that up
once at the beginning and reuse it so we don't have to hit the nova db
or neutron twice for the same thing.

Change-Id: I3ea4586d11b14da5f6d93e8d20f05171e7e6f0e8
Closes-bug: #1580621

commit_message:
hacking: Specify white list rules in noqa explicity

If 'noqa' is specified all hacking checks are disabled.
It is better to ignore specific rules explicitly rather than
ignoring all. The recent flake8 supports this [1].

[1] http://flake8.pycqa.org/en/latest/user/ignoring-errors.html

Change-Id: I74246adb4d1d2613c2703cf519428b64d00e59bb

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-05-27 10:14:10.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/volume/test_cinder.py', 'nova/volume/cinder.py'], 'message': "Avoid lazy-loading instance.id when cross_az_attach=False

The instance is no longer created in the API so the id attribute
won't be set, which means when checking the instance AZ against
the volume AZ, if they don't match we can't put the instance.id
in the error message. We shouldn't have been putting the instance
primary key in the error message anyway.

This fixes the bug by using the instance.uuid which is set in
this object in _provision_instances.

Change-Id: I396b767815b666706fec980ded482fa4746d2efc
Closes-Bug: #1693654
"}]
commit_message:
Avoid lazy-loading instance.id when cross_az_attach=False

The instance is no longer created in the API so the id attribute
won't be set, which means when checking the instance AZ against
the volume AZ, if they don't match we can't put the instance.id
in the error message. We shouldn't have been putting the instance
primary key in the error message anyway.

This fixes the bug by using the instance.uuid which is set in
this object in _provision_instances.

Change-Id: I396b767815b666706fec980ded482fa4746d2efc
Closes-Bug: #1693654

The JSON-Schema of integer string is without min length limits. That
leads to the user can input empty string, and nova API code can't
handle that case. Finally the user will get 500 returned.

The create_backup and multi_create API are fixed. The networks and
tenant_networks API have same problem on few parameters, but due
to the nova-network is deprecated, so just keep those nova-network
specific API behaviour as before.

Change-Id: I521e914fc48b7a221431f41c567f2cb4b9b4ab99
Closes-bug: #1652719
"}]
commit_message:
Limit the min length of string for integer JSON-Schema

The JSON-Schema of integer string is without min length limits. That
leads to the user can input empty string, and nova API code can't
handle that case. Finally the user will get 500 returned.

The create_backup and multi_create API are fixed. The networks and
tenant_networks API have same problem on few parameters, but due
to the nova-network is deprecated, so just keep those nova-network
specific API behaviour as before.

Change-Id: I521e914fc48b7a221431f41c567f2cb4b9b4ab99
Closes-bug: #1652719

commit_message:
Add method to invalidate metadata cache

This adds a method to invalidate an instance's metadata cache. This
will be needed later in the tagged attach series to make sure that the
metadata API picks up changes to an instance's device_metadata when a
tagged device has been attached.

Change-Id: Ic971173491126425f622203db73ae627c192228f
Implements: blueprint virt-device-tagged-attach-detach

commit_message:
Use GetFlattenedParametersAction

Tripleo-common introduces GetFlattenedParametersAction which
implements parameters and resources normalization. This change
updates GUI to use this action instead of doing normalization
on GUI side

commit_message:
Use plain routes list for os-migrations endpoint instead of stevedore

This patch adds os-migrations related routes by a plain list,
instead of using stevedore. After all the Nova API endpoints moves
to the plain routes list, the usage of stevedore for API loading will
be removed from Nova.

Partial-implement-blueprint api-no-more-extensions-pike

Change-Id: Ic6ded36d2247a01f8b41027cc07ef251b3570a46

subject: Log exception tracebacks
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-05-26 13:49:04.000000000', 'files': ['instack_undercloud/undercloud.py'], 'message': "Log exception tracebacks

If undercloud install/upgrade fails because of an exception, the log
didn't contain a traceback, so if the exception wasn't obvious from the
message, it was practically impossible to tell where the exception came
from when looking at the logs. This commit adds traceback logging.

Change-Id: Ifbc273b9c5a7de42aed8093d563d514348ddeaa3
Closes-Bug: #1693805
"}]
commit_message:
Log exception tracebacks

If undercloud install/upgrade fails because of an exception, the log
didn't contain a traceback, so if the exception wasn't obvious from the
message, it was practically impossible to tell where the exception came
from when looking at the logs. This commit adds traceback logging.

Change-Id: Ifbc273b9c5a7de42aed8093d563d514348ddeaa3
Closes-Bug: #1693805

Change-Id: I4d9f91b01de12cd0a676fc649953f98473b6b416

commit_message:
Migrate to oslo request_id middleware - mv 2.46

In order to support cross project request_id tracking, we need to be
on oslo.middleware for request_id. This makes that change now that
oslo middleware can support compat headers.

api-ref is not updated yet because x-compute-request-id was apparently
never documented there, and the timing on landing this is narrow
because the moment a requirements update happens we'll have this new
behavior.

Part of bp:oslo-middleware-request-id

Change-Id: I4d9f91b01de12cd0a676fc649953f98473b6b416

commit_message:
Use group_regex to group gabbi api tests

It seems that the tempest test runs at the gate are using
eight workers and the api tests distributed to multiple workers
from the same gabbi test yaml can result in in-consistencies[1].

[1] https://gabbi.readthedocs.io/en/latest/loader.html

Change-Id: I55d237358ec8a53ceeee51b0a982e1da4b1b23ee

stop referencing openstack gnocchi docs.

Change-Id: I28507aac37998cfa2e48dd1697822288f60e71fe

commit_message:
Generate subunit result for pingtest

We need test in subunit format first of all for tracking periodic
jobs in openstack-health, which identifies only jobs with subunit.
It could be usable for other statistics systems, which can parse
subunit format.

Change-Id: I28507aac37998cfa2e48dd1697822288f60e71fe

commit_message:
[Newton only] - Manually touch ssl.conf before installing mod_ssl

In I49bd6f0017048fbab8a4011d5d7c3ffc6cda85b6 we added manual install
of mod_ssl during the mitaka to newton upgrade for the related bug
below. However we also need to prevent that package from creating
the default ssl.conf with the Listen 443 as discussed in that bug.

Related-Bug: 1682448
Depends-On: Ie6e19cc838a3f45100f6c98a350bdf6a37d40590 
Change-Id: I04b8ccf8b8637b7b4fcc0c6182ef6cd3e30a8569

commit_message:
Add retries to the ::pacemaker::stonith property

Let's set a default number of retries also for the stonith
property creation. Just like we do for most of the composable
HA resource creation.

Closes-Bug: 1690132
Change-Id: Ie6e19cc838a3f45100f6c98a350bdf6a37d40590
Depends-On: I20098c5d69cde356fe79f6d8dbdc03ae42ecb3ef
(cherry picked from commit be7886a30443c82d7743be8cbdf0e0e2d3a1b26a)

commit_message:
Disable Telemetry on ovb-updates jobs

Disabling Telemetry on ovb-updates jobs to save memory, on Ocata and
Pike CIs.

Keep coverage for Newton since we didn't have scenario001 in place yet.

Change-Id: I5b0320ce369b86ce8fb70da6ecb3f39596f43b95
Related-Bug: #1693174
Depends-On: Idefe9f0de47c5b0f29b7326642d697ed179e2eb8
